text: Philip James Quinn Barry (June 18, 1896 â€“ December 3, 1949) was an American dramatist. He is best known for his plays Holiday (1928) and The Philadelphia Story (1939). He was born in Rochester, New York. Barry died from a heart attack in New York City, New York, aged 53. ==Further reading== *Anderson, Donald R.
